001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc.cli;
002
003import java.util.stream.Stream;
004
005/**
006 * JSON-RPC method parameter, parsed from the command-line. There are two implementations: {@link Valid} and {@link Invalid}.
007 * A {@code Valid} contains an object that can be serialized to JSON via a converter/mapper like Jackson. An {@code Invalid}
008 * contains the {@link Exception} that occurred while parsing.
009 */
010public sealed interface CliParameter {
011    /**
012     * Return the source (pre-deserialization) JSON string
013     * @return source string
014     */
015    String source();
016
017    default boolean valid() {
018        return this instanceof CliParameter.Valid;
019    }
020
021    default boolean invalid() {
022        return !valid();
023    }
024
025    /**
026     * Stream zero or 1 valid objects.
027     * <p>This allows {@code .flatMap(CliParameter::stream)} to filter invalid and unwrap valid objects.
028     * @return A stream of zero or one valid objects.
029     */
030    Stream<Object> stream();
031
032    /**
033     * Create a {@code Valid} object
034     * @param source The source CLI string
035     * @param object The resulting object
036     * @return a valid parameter
037     */
038    static Valid valid(String source, Object object) {
039        return new Valid(source, object);
040    }
041
042    /**
043     * Create a {@code Invalid} object
044     * @param source The source CLI string
045     * @param error The error returned from the parser
046     * @return a valid parameter
047     */
048    static Invalid invalid(String source, Exception error) {
049        return new Invalid(source, error);
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Parse a string returning either a valid or invalid {@code CliParameter}
054     * @param source the CLI parameter string to parse
055     * @param parseFunction a parsing function
056     * @return wraps either parsed, serializable object or an {@code Exception}
057     */
058    static CliParameter parse(String source, Parser parseFunction) {
059        try {
060            return new CliParameter.Valid(source, parseFunction.apply(source));
061        } catch (Exception e) {
062            return new CliParameter.Invalid(source, e);
063        }
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * Implementation for Valid objects
068     * @param source source JSON string
069     * @param object parsed object
070     */
071    record Valid(String source, Object object) implements CliParameter {
072        public Stream<Object> stream() { return Stream.of(object); }
073    }
074
075    /**
076     * Implementation for Invalid source strings
077     * @param source source JSON string
078     * @param error parsing exception
079     */
080    record Invalid(String source, Exception error) implements CliParameter {
081        public Stream<Object> stream() { return Stream.empty(); }
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Functional interface for parsing a {@link String} to an {@link Object} possibly
086     * throwing an {@link Exception}.
087     */
088    @FunctionalInterface
089    interface Parser {
090        Object apply(String s) throws Exception;
091    }
092}
